abstract.text: Returns the scores for the local player and other players for the specified type of player, time period, and ranks.

inlineContent.text: Specifies whether to get scores from friends or all players.
Specifies the time period for the scores. This parameter is applicable to nonrecurring leaderboards only. For recurring leaderboards, pass
for this parameter.
Specifies the range of ranks to use for getting the scores. The difference between the minimum rank and maximum rank must not exceed

The block receives the following parameters:

GameKit uses the following algorithm to fetch
scores:
Begins with the set of all possible scores for the leaderboard.
Discards any scores that don’t match the
and
properties.
For each player, keeps the best score that player earns and discards the rest.
Sorts the scores from best to worst.
Uses the range property to determine which scores return.

abstract.text: Enable players to interact with friends, compare leaderboard ranks, earn achievements, and participate in multiplayer games.
A leaderboard for a game that Game Center stores.
Information about a single score by a player on a leaderboard.
Specifies the type of players for filtering data.
Specifies the time period for filtering data.
Returns the scores for the local player and other players for the specified time period.
Returns the scores for the local player and other players for the specified type of player, time period, and ranks.
Let players measure their own progress and compare their skills with friends and others.

doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/Ga.title: Encourage progress and competition with leaderboards

abstract.text: The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
A type representing an error value that can be thrown.
